page.title: 15The Lamb Cricket Club
page.content: The pitch is behind the public house, it is small but has a very good wicket. Also it has a very good outfield.But there is one problem,the ball sometimes goes in the brook which goes round the on-side of the pitch.There is also a field on the off-side. In 1984 there was a one wicket final in aid of Joe Weaden.And there is a bench there that has a plaque on it to remember him. The under 15's got through the semi-final of a competition but they got beaten by Press Steel in the final. There is an old green shed in the corner of the field which used to be used as the dressing rooms!But now there is a proper pavilion. The men look forward to the end of the match when some of the mum's put on a cricket tea;then afterwards....a pint!
